GitHub Training Program for CSMs & CSAs

Welcome to the complete, hands-on GitHub training program! This comprehensive curriculum is designed to take you from GitHub novice to expert advisor, following the natural software development lifecycle.

üéØ Who This Is For

  • Experienced CSMs transitioning into GitHub roles
  • Customer Success Architects new to developer tools
  • Technical Account Managers entering the DevOps space
  • Anyone with strong customer-facing skills but no prior GitHub/software development experience

üìö Program Structure

This 12-week program is organized into three progressive phases, each containing multiple focused modules that build upon each other:

üå± Beginner Phase (Weeks 1-4)

Foundation: Understanding Software Development & GitHub Basics

Master the fundamentals of software development, version control, and GitHub‚Äôs core features.

Modules: - Module 1: Understanding Software Development & SDLC - Module 2: Git Fundamentals & Version Control - Module 3: GitHub.com Platform Essentials - Module 4: Source Code Management as a Process

What You‚Äôll Build: - Your first Git repository with proper version control - A collaborative project with issues, PRs, and code reviews - Understanding of how software teams work and plan

üöÄ Intermediate Phase (Weeks 5-8)

Development: Automation, Security & CI/CD

Learn GitHub Actions, security features, and continuous integration/deployment pipelines.

Modules: - Module 5: GitHub Actions & Automation Basics - Module 6: Code Security with GitHub Advanced Security (GHAS) - Module 7: Dependency & Package Management - Module 8: CI/CD Pipelines & Deployment Strategies

What You‚Äôll Build: - Automated testing and CI workflows - Security scanning and vulnerability management - Complete multi-environment deployment pipeline - Package publishing to GitHub Packages

üèÜ Advanced Phase (Weeks 9-14)

Enterprise: Administration, Governance, AI & Performance

Master enterprise-scale GitHub management, APIs, compliance, DevOps metrics, and AI-powered development with Copilot.

Modules: - Module 9: Enterprise Administration & Integration - Module 10: GitHub APIs, Webhooks & GitHub Apps - Module 11: Infrastructure as Code & Operations - Module 12: Governance, Compliance & DORA Metrics - Module 13: GitHub Copilot Fundamentals - Module 14: GitHub Copilot Advanced

What You‚Äôll Build: - Enterprise organization with teams and policies - Custom integrations using GitHub APIs - Infrastructure as Code deployment pipelines - DORA metrics dashboard for DevOps performance - AI-powered developer workflows with Copilot - Custom MCP servers and Copilot Extensions

üéì Learning Approach

Each module follows a consistent structure designed for hands-on learning:

1. Context & Overview

Understand why this topic matters and where it fits in the SDLC

2. Core Concepts

Learn the fundamental concepts and terminology with clear explanations

3. Guided Walkthrough

Step-by-step instructions with screenshots and commands

4. Hands-On Lab

Apply what you learned in a practical exercise

5. Knowledge Check

Test your understanding with quiz questions

6. Resources

Links to official docs, Microsoft Learn modules, and GitHub Skills courses

7. Real-World Scenarios

Customer use cases and common questions you‚Äôll encounter as a CSM/CSA

‚è±Ô∏è Time Commitment

  • Per Module: 8-12 hours (reading, videos, labs)
  • Per Week: 15-20 hours
  • Total Program: 12 weeks (~200 hours)

üèÖ Assessment & Certification

Continuous Assessment

  • Weekly Lab Completion (50%) - Hands-on exercises with working repositories
  • Knowledge Checks (25%) - End-of-module quizzes and demonstrations
  • Phase Milestones (25%) - Three major projects demonstrating cumulative skills

Phase Milestones

  • Beginner Milestone: Present a repository with proper branching, protection rules, and collaboration workflow
  • Intermediate Milestone: Build and demo a complete CI/CD pipeline with security scanning and DORA metrics
  • Advanced Milestone: Conduct an enterprise security audit with governance recommendations

GitHub Certifications

Upon completion, you‚Äôll be prepared for: - ‚úÖ GitHub Foundations Certification - ‚úÖ GitHub Actions Certification - ‚úÖ GitHub Advanced Security Certification - ‚úÖ GitHub Administration Certification

üöÄ Getting Started

Prerequisites

Before starting, ensure you have: - [ ] GitHub account (personal or enterprise trial) - [ ] Git installed locally (Download Git) - [ ] Visual Studio Code or preferred IDE (Download VS Code) - [ ] GitHub CLI installed (Install gh) - [ ] Basic understanding of command-line interfaces

üìä Success Metrics

By completing this program, you‚Äôll be able to:

Technical Proficiency

‚úÖ Demonstrate all GitHub core features across the entire SDLC
‚úÖ Design and implement end-to-end CI/CD pipelines
‚úÖ Configure and advise on GitHub Advanced Security features
‚úÖ Architect enterprise-scale GitHub deployments
‚úÖ Build integrations using GitHub APIs, webhooks, and GitHub Apps

Software Development Competency

‚úÖ Understand and articulate the complete Software Development Lifecycle
‚úÖ Guide customers through Git workflows and best practices
‚úÖ Explain DevOps principles and map them to GitHub capabilities
‚úÖ Implement and measure DORA metrics for DevOps performance

Customer Success Skills

‚úÖ Troubleshoot common customer issues independently
‚úÖ Create compelling demonstrations and proof-of-concepts
‚úÖ Assess customer maturity and recommend improvement paths
‚úÖ Apply best practices frameworks to customer architectures

üí° Study Tips

  1. Complete all hands-on labs - Practical experience is crucial for retention
  2. Create a portfolio repository - Document your learning journey in a GitHub repo
  3. Join GitHub Community - Ask questions and engage with other learners
  4. Practice explaining concepts - Teach what you learn to reinforce understanding
  5. Build sample projects - Showcase multiple skills in realistic scenarios
  6. Collaborate with peers - Work on shared learning repositories

üìû Need Help?

  • GitHub Community Discussions: Ask questions
  • GitHub Docs: Official documentation
  • Microsoft Learn: GitHub training paths
  • GitHub Skills: Interactive tutorials
